text: ydroxylase deficiency ?,"What are the signs and symptoms of Non-classic congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency? The signs and symptoms of non-classic congenital adrenal hyperplasia due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency (NCAH) may develop any time after birth. Affected people generally experience symptoms of androgen (male hormone) excess such as acne, premature development of pubic hair, accelerated growth, advanced bone age, and reduced adult height.
